      • block

        public BindingBlock block(QualifiedName namespace,
                          DataSource id,
                          boolean internal)
        Description copied from interface: BindingBlocker
        Create a block on a resource which can be uniquely identified by the given namespace and id.

        The invoking thread does not immediately wait on the block, and so the invocation returns immediately.

        Specified by:
        block in interface BindingBlocker
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace of the pending dependency
        id - The id of the pending dependency
        internal - Whether the block should only allow internal resolution, as opposed to possible satisfaction via external sources
        Returns:

      • addParticipatingThread

        public void addParticipatingThread(Thread processingThread)
        Description copied from interface: BindingBlocker
        Register a thread as a participant in the binding/unbinding process. This helps the processor determine whether there is unblocked activity, or otherwise detect a deadlock or unsatisfied dependency.
        Specified by:
        addParticipatingThread in interface BindingBlocker
        Parameters:
        processingThread - The thread participating in processing

      • getBlocks

        public Set<BindingBlock> getBlocks()
        Specified by:
        getBlocks in interface BindingBlocks
        Returns:
        All blocks in the binding process which are still incomplete

      • waitForAll

        public void waitForAll()
                throws InterruptedException,
                       ExecutionException
        Description copied from interface: BindingBlocks
        Wait until no blocks remain held in the binding system. This may not signify the end of binding, or that more blocks will not occur.
        Specified by:
        waitForAll in interface BindingBlocks
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - The waiting thread was interrupted
        ExecutionException - The blocking dependency failed resolution with the causing exception

      • waitForAll

        public void waitForAll(long timeoutMilliseconds)
                throws InterruptedException,
                       TimeoutException,
                       ExecutionException
        Description copied from interface: BindingBlocks
        Wait until no blocks remain held in the binding system, or until the given time period ends. Successful invocation may not signify the end of binding, or that more blocks will not occur.
        Specified by:
        waitForAll in interface BindingBlocks
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - The waiting thread was interrupted
        TimeoutException - The timeout period elapsed before the blocks were resolved
        ExecutionException - The blocking dependency failed resolution with the causing exception

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked()
        Description copied from interface: BindingBlocks
        Determine whether the binding block system as a whole is blocked. It is considered blocked if every participating Thread registered with the associated BindingBlocker is waiting on a block via BindingBlocks.waitForAll(), or BindingBlock.waitUntilComplete(), etc.

        Note: If this is the case, and it is also the case that all threads are blocked on internal, not external, dependencies, the binding will fail.

        Specified by:
        isBlocked in interface BindingBlocks
        Returns:
        True if the binding is blocked and no processing threads are active, false otherwise

        public boolean isDeadlocked()

              throws InterruptedException,
                     ExecutionException
        Throws:

        ExecutionException
